meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of commerce or business.
meanings.sent1: The store's commercialistic approach to sales helped them attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Her commercialistic mindset made her a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent3: The commercialistic nature of the market made even the smallest businesses thrive.
meanings.sent4: In the world of commerce, a commercialistic strategy can lead to great success.
meanings.sent5: The commercialistic atmosphere of the trade show was bustling with activity.

meanings.definition: Focused on making a profit or generating revenue.
meanings.sent1: The company's commercialistic goals drove them to expand their product line.
meanings.sent2: His commercialistic mindset always prioritized financial gain over other factors.
meanings.sent3: The commercialistic focus of the business sometimes overshadowed ethical considerations.
meanings.sent4: She approached her investments with a commercialistic eye, always seeking maximum returns.
meanings.sent5: The commercialistic nature of the industry demanded constant innovation to stay ahead.
